org.pepppt.core.events

Enum CoreEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<CoreEvent>
      • org.pepppt.core.events.CoreEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<CoreEvent>

    public enum CoreEvent
extends java.lang.Enum<CoreEvent>
    Events will be send to the callback of the ui.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      APP_HAS_BATTERY_OPTIMIZATION_ENABLED

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • BLUETOOTH_HAS_BEEN_TURNED_OFF

        public static final CoreEvent BLUETOOTH_HAS_BEEN_TURNED_OFF
        This event will be send if bluetooth has been disabled by the user or some other instance.

      • BLUETOOTH_HAS_BEEN_TURNED_ON

        public static final CoreEvent BLUETOOTH_HAS_BEEN_TURNED_ON
        This event can occur when the user switches off the bluetooth. The core will automatically turn it on again and then sends this event. The ui should then generate a notification that will inform the user about this automatic enabling and can provide further instructions and reasons why bluetooth is neccessary for the app when the user clicks on the notification. args is null.

      • INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS

        public static final CoreEvent INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS
        This event will be send to the ui in case of missing permissions. The ui should then generate a notification. Clicking on the notification should provide informations on why the app needs these permissions. args: MissingPermissionsEventArgs.

      • MISSING_FEATURE_BLE

        public static final CoreEvent MISSING_FEATURE_BLE
        This event will be send if the core cant find the bluetooth le feature on the device. Are you running in the emulator? args is null.

      • APP_HAS_BATTERY_OPTIMIZATION_ENABLED

        public static final CoreEvent APP_HAS_BATTERY_OPTIMIZATION_ENABLED
        This event will be send if the app is not ignoring battery optimization. The app should then disable the battery optimization by its own. args is null.

      • NEW_EBID

        public static final CoreEvent NEW_EBID
        This event will be send by the core when a new broadcast id has been set by the core. args is null. This will happen every 30min.

      • NEW_EBID_LIST

        public static final CoreEvent NEW_EBID_LIST
        This event will be send by the core when it successfully receives a new batch of ids from the keyserver. This will happen every 24h args is null.

      • CORE_IS_READY

        public static final CoreEvent CORE_IS_READY
        Will be send after Core.create(). Signals that the core is running. args is null.

      • CORE_IS_STALLED

        public static final CoreEvent CORE_IS_STALLED
        Will be send if the core has been stalled. This can happen when the batch of EBID is empty. Use this event to show an status icon in your ui that the core is currently not able to scan or broadcast any data. When the phone has no coverage for some time the internal EBIDs can run out. After this time the core needs coverage again to retrieve a new list of EBIDs.

      • CORE_RESUMED_FROM_STALL

        public static final CoreEvent CORE_RESUMED_FROM_STALL
        This event will be send if the core can proceed with its work after a stall (CORE_IS_STALLED). This happens if the core received a new batch of EBIDs from the backend. Use this event to show a ready/healty icon in your ui that the app is running fine.

      • TAN_ACTIVATION_SUCCEDED

        public static final CoreEvent TAN_ACTIVATION_SUCCEDED
        This event will be send if the upload can start.

      • UPLOAD_STARTED

        public static final CoreEvent UPLOAD_STARTED
        These events will be send during the upload of the use.

      • UPLOAD_PROGRESS

        public static final CoreEvent UPLOAD_PROGRESS

      • UPLOAD_FAILED

        public static final CoreEvent UPLOAD_FAILED

      • UPLOAD_FINISHED

        public static final CoreEvent UPLOAD_FINISHED

      • UPLOAD_PAUSED

        public static final CoreEvent UPLOAD_PAUSED

      • REGISTRATION_SUCCESS

        public static final CoreEvent REGISTRATION_SUCCESS
        Events for initial device registration at the backend

      • REGISTRATION_FAILED

        public static final CoreEvent REGISTRATION_FAILED

      • NEW_TAN

        public static final CoreEvent NEW_TAN
        Will be send to the ui callback after calling ProximityTracingService.requestTan() args: NewTanEventArgs

      • TAN_REQUEST_FAILED

        public static final CoreEvent TAN_REQUEST_FAILED
        Error while requesting the tan.

      • TAN_ACTIVATION_FAILED

        public static final CoreEvent TAN_ACTIVATION_FAILED
        Error while activating the tan.
